processing_notes: Source states: '1290 suspect cholera cases (199 confirmed cases) and 47 deaths (20 among confirmed cases) reported nationally since 1 February 2023' - interpreted as sCh=1290 suspect cases, cCh=199 confirmed cases, deaths=47

Source states: 'Gauteng remains the hardest-hit province at 89%, with 176 cases reported in three districts' and 'Gauteng which accounts for at least 92% or 152 cases' - calculated as ~92% of 1290 national cases = 1188 cases

source: WHO Disease Outbreak News South Africa Historical
processing_notes: Source states: 'the Kwazulu-Natal Department of Health has reported 62 607 cases and 131 deaths since the start of the outbreak in mid-August 2000' - interpreted as sCh=62607 cases, deaths=131

source: WHO Disease Outbreak News South Africa Historical
processing_notes: Source states: 'From 1 January to 28 March 2003, the cumulative number of reported cholera cases in South Africa is 2362' - interpreted as sCh=2362 cases

source: WHO Disease Outbreak News South Africa Historical
processing_notes: Source states: 'From 26 April to 18 May, the cumulative number of suspected and confirmed cholera cases is 174 with 3 deaths (case fatality ratio 1.7%)' - interpreted as sCh=174 cases, deaths=3

Source states: 'During the cholera epidemic in South Africa, 1980-1987, 25,251 cases of cholera were bacteriologically proven. The case-fatality rate was 1.4%' - interpreted as sCh=25251 cases, calculated deaths=353 (1.4% of 25251)

Source states: 'By late January 2009 some 6,000 cases of cholera had been reported in South Africa, nearly half of which occurred in Limpopo province, near the Zimbabwe border' - interpreted as sCh=6000 cases from cross-border transmission

Source states: 'Free State Province accounts for 5% which translates into 9 cases' and later 'Free State accounts for 6%, with 11 cases' - using most recent count and calculated as ~8% of national total = 103 cases

Source states: 'A cholera epidemic that took place in KwaZulu-Natal province, South Africa, in 2000–2001 resulted in over 100,000 cases, however, an effective public health response limited the case-fatality ratio to 0.22%' - interpreted as sCh=100000 cases, calculated deaths=220

Source states: 'Two laboratory-confirmed cholera cases were detected in Limpopo, both imported from Zimbabwe. The first case was a 43-year-old male in the Musina sub-district, and the second was a 27-year-old man' - interpreted as cCh=2 confirmed cases

Source states: 'There have been four laboratory-confirmed cases of cholera in South Africa since the Zimbabwean outbreak began' and 'one travel-related case was reported in South Africa' - interpreted as cCh=4 confirmed cases linked to Zimbabwe outbreak
Source states: 'Limpopo recorded 1 confirmed case during the 2023 outbreak' and later reports indicated '4 cases total' in Limpopo - interpreted as sCh=4 cases
Source states: 'North West recorded 3 confirmed cases during the February-June 2023 outbreak period, with later reports indicating 5 infections total' - interpreted as sCh=5 cases

Source states: 'An outbreak of cholera due to toxigenic, antimicrobial-resistant, extended-spectrum-β-lactamase (ESBL)-producing strains of V. cholerae O1 was associated with illegal miners at a gold mine in the Ehlanzeni district of the Mpumalanga Province of South Africa between May and July 2008. Thirty-four laboratory-confirmed cases of cholera, including 5 deaths, were reported' - interpreted as cCh=34 confirmed cases, deaths=5

Source states: 'The total cumulative number of cholera cases recorded was 5,489 since the outbreak was first detected in the province. Total number of deaths confirmed was 30, with the breakdown per municipality being: Bushbuckridge 22, Mbombela North five, Mbombela South two and Thaba Chweu one' - interpreted as sCh=5489 cases, deaths=30

Source states: 'A case of cholera has been confirmed in the Nelson Mandela Bay metro' and 'following a confirmed cholera case received by the NMBM municipal health services office, after the metro received a notification of a case of cholera (Vibrio Cholerae 01) from a resident living in Walmer Township, Gqeberha' - interpreted as cCh=1 confirmed case

Source states: 'the cholera death toll in the province stands at one, while there have been at least eight positive cases in the province' and 'cases have centred around Vredefort, Parys, and surrounding areas of the Fezile Dabi District Municipality' - interpreted as sCh=8 cases, deaths=1

Source states: 'The North West Department of Health confirmed one cholera case in Rustenburg on April 7, 2025' and 'The patient was admitted at Life Peglerae Hospital in Rustenburg on April 5, 2025, with medical tests confirmed by the National Institution of Communicable Disease (NICD)' - interpreted as cCh=1 confirmed case

Source states: 'Limpopo recorded its first cholera case in May 2023, with a 26-year-old Zimbabwean national reporting to Musina Hospital on Friday after experiencing severe symptoms, including vomiting and dehydration' - interpreted as sCh=1 case

source: CDC Emerging Infectious Diseases NICD Surveillance 2015-2017
processing_notes: Source confirms zero cholera transmission during 2015-2017 period - validated absence via NICD surveillance system. Source states: 'Since the 2008–2009 outbreak, few cases have been identified: 5 during 2010–2014, most of which were imported, and none during 2015–2017' - documented as confirmed cholera-free period
